text: Igor Yuriyevich Nikulin (; born August 14, 1960 in Moscow, Russian SFSR) is a former hammer thrower who represented the USSR, the Unified Team, and later Russia. He won the bronze medal at the 1992 Olympic Games in Barcelona, Spain. One of the most remarkable performances in all of hammer throwing is Igor Nikulin's U23 world record of 83.54 m set 1982-09-02 in Athína, which then was good enough to put him 2nd in the world through all time behind Sergey Litvinov on 83.98 m. His personal best of 84.48 m was set on July 12, 1990 in Lausanne currently putting him 7th through all time. His father Yuriy Nikulin finished fourth at the men's hammer throw at the 1964 Summer Olympics. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing the |- |1979 |European Junior Championships |Bydgoszcz, Poland |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |71.56 m |- |1982 |European Championships |Athens, Greece |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |79.44 m |- |1983 |World Championships |Helsinki, Finland | 4th |79.34 m |- |1984 |Friendship Games |Moscow, Soviet Union |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |82.56 m |- |rowspan=2|1986 |Goodwill Games |Moscow, Soviet Union |5th |78.50 m |- |European Championships |Stuttgart, West Germany |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |82.00 m |- |1987 |World Championships |Rome, Italy |5th |80.18 m |- |rowspan=2|1990 |Goodwill Games |Seattle, United States |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |82.14 m |- |European Championships |Split, Yugoslavia |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |80.02 m |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |81.38 m |- |IAAF World Cup |Havana, Cuba |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |78.28 m |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |4th |78.38 m |} ==External links== * Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Russian male hammer throwers Category:Soviet male hammer throwers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of the Unified Team Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Unified Team Category:Sportspeople from Moscow Category:European Athletics Championships medalists Category:Medalists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics Category:Universiade bronze medalists for the Soviet Union Category:CIS Athletics Championships winners
title: Igor Nikulin (hammer thrower)
